channel.title: [PI] How does NPCDrops.cfg work?
channel.description:
Hello people, There's 1 thing I don't understand about pi: The npcdrops. For example: I want the corporeal beast(ID=3500) to have: 1% chance of divine (ID=13740) 5% chance of spirit shield (ID=13744) 7% chance of holy elixer (ID=13750)
Post the code so I can understand?

item.title: [PI] How does NPCDrops.cfg work?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

First of all , the drops are done in NPCDrops.TSM
Second , the pattern goes like this :

npcID:rareFactor   regItemId:amount   regItemId:amount
rareItemId:amount   rareItemId:amount

the first piece is the most essential , anything behind that in the first line are regular drops.
Anything on the second line are rare drops ( also pop up in lootshare ).
rareFactor determines how much chance a player has to get a drop from the rare item list ; the higher rareFactor is , the more the player has to kill that monster to get a chance on a rare item.

Read full topic
